metadata.title: CVE-2019-10190 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was discovered in DNS resolver component of knot resolverthrough version 3.2.0 before 4.1.0 which allows remote attackers to bypassDNSSEC validation for non-existence answer. NXDOMAIN answer would getpassed through to the client even if its DNSSEC validation failed, insteadof sending a SERVFAIL packet. Caching is not affected by this particularbug but see CVE-2019-10191.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot-resolver - 5.4.4-1
knot-resolver-module-http - 5.4.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot-resolver package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.4-1').
